select.name: style_css
select.label: Colour scheme
select.tooltip: Select the colour scheme of your website.

option.name: more colour schemes in the pro version

textfield.name: website_width
textfield.label: Website Width:
textfield.tooltip: Just type in the number, either in px or %. Default is 1000. Tip: If you use the full-width slider, don't make your site bigger than 1006px, or use the normal slider with preview.

select.name: website_width_unit
select.label: Fluid or static width?
select.tooltip: Do you want your layout fluid(%) or static(px)? Notes: when you use the slideshow, better don't use fluid width. And if you use the slideshow shadow, it only looks nice with a static width between 990 and about 1100px.

select.name: add_custom_background
select.label: Use standard WP settings
select.tooltip: Enable this option, if you like to use the standard wordpress settings page.

colorpicker.tooltip: Change the colour of the vertical lines. Tip: Best is to have them in the colour of the background and other lines.

textfield.label: Font size
textfield.tooltip: Change the standard font size, default is 13px, just enter a number

colorpicker.name: font_color
colorpicker.label: Font colour
colorpicker.tooltip: Change font colour

colorpicker.name: link_color
colorpicker.label: Link colour
colorpicker.tooltip: Change link colour Notes: You just need to change the link colour to have a nice effect on all link and button colours. The hover colour will automatically be your font colour or the default font colour. Optional, you can also choose a hover colour, background colour, background hover colour or if and when to underline.

colorpicker.name: link_color_hover
colorpicker.label: Link hover colour
colorpicker.tooltip: Change link colour for mouse moves over.

select.name: link_color_subnav_adapt
select.label: BP subnavigation adapting
select.tooltip: Use link hover colour for the BuddyPress subnav also? By default the subnav links adapts the link colour and link hover colour. Sometimes the link hover colour can look ugly here and you don't want the subnav to adapt. Then you can change the colour adapting here easily.

select.name: link_underline
select.label: Link underline
select.tooltip: Choose if (and when) to underline links.

colorpicker.name: link_bg_color
colorpicker.label: Link bg colour
colorpicker.tooltip: Change link background colour.

colorpicker.name: link_bg_color_hover
colorpicker.label: Link bg hover colour
colorpicker.tooltip: Change link background colour for mouse moves over. Watch out you have enough contrast to the (hover) link colour and also the font colour!

select.name: link_styling_title_adapt
select.label: Titles adapting
select.tooltip: Do you like to use the link background colours or underline effetcs for the titles (h1-h6) also? By default they adapt just the link colour and link hover colour.

select.name: default_homepage_style
select.label: Post listing style
select.tooltip: Select a style how to display the latest posts. You can also list your posts in magazine style, showing the featured images, check out our our FAQ.

select.name: default_homepage_hide_date
select.label: Show date, category and author
select.tooltip: Show or hide the date, category and author in the post listing.

textfield.name: header_height
textfield.label: Header height
textfield.tooltip: Your header height in px (and navigation position (y) at the same time), just enter a number. This is not your header image height, you can specify your header image separately in the fields below. Try 25px or 63px less than your header-image-height to fit perfectly...

select.name: header_width
select.label: Header width
select.tooltip: Do you like the header in full width or as wide as your site?

file.name: header_img
file.label: Header image
file.tooltip: Insert your own header image. Upload or insert url. Default width is 1000px, the height (and full width option) can be adjusted above. For no image write none.

select.name: header_img_repeat
select.label: Header image repeat
select.tooltip: Repeat header image: x=horizontally, y=vertically

select.name: header_img_x
select.label: Header image x-position
select.tooltip: If header image is smaller, you can choose to align left, center or right

textfield.name: header_img_y
textfield.label: Header image y-position
textfield.tooltip: Distance from header image to top (in px), just enter a number

select.name: bp_login_bar_top
select.label: Login bar header
select.tooltip: Select a login bar at the top of the header

select.name: bp_default_navigation
select.label: Use Buddypress default sub-navigation
select.tooltip: This sub-navigation is the secondary level navigation, e.g. for profile it contains: [Public, Edit Profile, Change Avatar] If you use the community navigation widget, you don't need this navigation. If you want to use a horizontally sub-navigation - choose this one.

colorpicker.name: bg_content_nav_color
colorpicker.label: BuddyPress sub navigation background colour
colorpicker.tooltip: Change the background colour of the Buddypress component sub navigation

select.name: menue_enable_search
select.label: Show search bar
select.tooltip: enable BuddyPress search bar in header

select.name: buddydev_search
select.label: Use global Buddydev search instead of bp-search
select.tooltip: Replace the BuddyPress search (which comes with dropdown menu) with the Buddydev search. The Buddydev search is an easy one-field global search with nice result-listing.

select.name: searchbar_x
select.label: Search bar x-position
select.tooltip: If selected, you want the search bar left or right?

textfield.name: searchbar_y
textfield.label: Search bar y-position
textfield.tooltip: Distance from search bar to top (in px), just enter a number

select.name: login_sidebar
select.label: Login sidebar
select.tooltip: Turn auto Buddypress login in the right sidebar on/off. You can add this feature as a widget into every widgetarea you like.

textfield.name: bp_login_sidebar_text
textfield.label: Login sidebar text
textfield.tooltip: Define the text displayed in the login sidebar when you're logged out.

select.name: bp_profile_header
select.label: Show Profile header
select.tooltip: Display profile header, can be used as widget area

select.name: bp_profile_sidebars
select.label: Profile Sidebars
select.tooltip: Where do you like to have your sidebars in profiles? default = the global settings and sidebars will be used none = no sidebars, full width left = left profile sidebar, this will overwrite the global settings and display the left profile sidebar right = right profile sidebar, this will overwrite the global settings and display the right profile sidebar left and right = This option will display the left and right profile sidebars and overwrite the global settings Note: all sidebars can be filled with widgets. Without widgets there will be the user avatar and information like in the member header

textfield.name: bp_profiles_avatar_size
textfield.label: Profile avatar size
textfield.tooltip: Define the size of the profile avatar. Width and height is the same.

textfield.name: bp_profiles_nav_order
textfield.label: Profile menu order
textfield.tooltip: Change the menu order in the profiles. Write the order in by slug, comma-separated. Note: a slug is the name as it is written in the url, means all letters in small, no symbols, ...

select.name: bp_groups_header
select.label: Show Groups header
select.tooltip: Display group header, can be used as widget area

select.name: bp_groups_sidebars
select.label: Groups Sidebars
select.tooltip: Where do you like to have your sidebars in groups? default = the global settings and sidebars will be used none = no sidebars, full width left = left group sidebar, this will overwrite the global settings and display the left group sidebar right = right group sidebar, this will overwrite the global settings and display the right group sidebar left and right = This option will display the left and right group sidebars and overwrite the global settings Note: all sidebars can be filled with widgets. Without widgets there will be the user avatar and information like in the group header

textfield.name: bp_groups_avatar_size
textfield.label: Groups avatar size
textfield.tooltip: Define the size of the group avatar. Width and height is the same.

textfield.name: bp_groups_nav_order
textfield.label: Groups menu order
textfield.tooltip: Change the menu order in the groups. Write the order in by slug, comma-separated. Note: a slug is the name as it is written in the url, means all letters in small, no symbols, ...

select.name: enable_slideshow_home
select.label: Enable slideshow
select.tooltip: Enable slideshow

select.name: slideshow_cat
select.label: Slideshow post categories
select.tooltip: The slideshow takes images, titles and text-excerpts of the last 4 posts. You can select the category the posts should be taken from. For more info check out the.

textfield.name: slideshow_amount
textfield.label: Amount
textfield.tooltip: Define the amount of posts. This option works just with the full width image slider.

textfield.name: slideshow_post_type
textfield.label: Post type
textfield.tooltip: Define the post type to display instead of posts. For pages write 'page', for a custom post type the name of the cutsom post type, e.g. 'radio'

textfield.name: slideshow_show_page
textfield.label: Page IDs
textfield.tooltip: Page IDs, comma separated. Just working if you use post types instead of categories

textfield.name: slideshow_time
textfield.label: Sliding time
textfield.tooltip: Define the sliding time in ms

select.name: slideshow_style
select.label: Slideshow style
select.tooltip: Select a type of slideshow.

select.name: slideshow_caption
select.label: Caption
select.tooltip: Show just the images or also titles and excerpts?

select.name: slideshow_shadow
select.label: Shadow
select.tooltip: Select if you'd like to have a shadow under the top slideshow. Note: just for bright background and static width between 990 and about 1100 pixels.
